title: Santa Ana PD/Orange County Public Records BWC of Investigation

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Copies of Body Worn Cameras footage of the Investigation to Angel Castillo's family home/residence and any interactions with the family starting from February 25th, 2024 to the filing date of this request. I would also ask for copies of the officers that responded to the incident and any personnel on duty that interacted with family members of the Castillo family. The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Victor Manuel Santos

title: MS Corrections data dictionaries

communications.subject: Mississippi Public Records Act Request: MS Corrections data dictionaries
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Mississippi Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1) All data dictionaries and schemas used for or associated with databases (or other data repositories) used by the Mississippi Department of Corrections' offender management system.

2) Any documents sufficient to explain, detail, or describe the contents of tables and fields in any database (including which are considered exempt from disclosure or otherwise restricted, if applicable) used by the Mississippi Department of Corrections' offender management system.

“Data dictionary” refers to any set of information describing the contents of a database, including details about tables, columns, data types, and relationships among tables.

"Schema" refers to any set of information describing a database's overall structure and organization.

"Offender management system" refers to the database or software system that MDOC uses to manage information on all aspects of an offender’s incarcerations from intake to release.

The requested documents will be used for academic research. This request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Stewart, Ph.D.

A psychoacoustic-masking model to predict the perception of speech-like stimuli in background noise: by James J. Hant *, Abeer Alwan. 

James J. Hant *, Abeer Alwan. 

"In this paper, a time/frequency, multi-look masking model is proposed to predict the detection and discrimination of speech-like stimuli in a variety of noise environments. In the first stage of the model, sound is processed through an auditory front end which includes bandpass filtering, squaring, time windowing, logarithmic compression and additive internal noise. The result is an internal representation of time/frequency “looks” for each sound stimulus. To detect or discriminate a signal in noise, the listener combines information across looks using a weighted d′ detection device. Parameters of the model are fit to previously measured masked thresholds of bandpass noises which vary in bandwidth, duration, and center frequency (JASA 101 (1997) 2789). The resulting model is successful in predicting masked thresholds of spectrally shaped noise bursts, glides, and formant transitions of varying durations. The model is also successful in predicting the discrimination of synthetic plosive CV syllables in a variety of noise environments and vowel contexts.”


"Traditional masking models (e.g. Fletcher, 1940; Patterson, 1976) focus on the masking of long duration, narrowband stimuli by noise. In these models, the signal and masker are filtered through an auditory filter that is centered around the signals center frequency. If the filtered signal-to-noise ratio (SNR) is greater than a certain threshold, then the signal is heard. To predict the noise masking of a wide-band, non-stationary signal such as speech, however, the effects of both signal duration and bandwidth must be characterized (over a large frequency and duration range). In addition, for a model to predict perceptual confusions of speech sounds in noise, it should be able to predict the results of discrimination as well as detection experiments. To our knowledge, there is no published work which presents a masking model”

Perceptually flat noise masks all frequency regions equally (on an ERB scale) and will thus greatly affect the high-frequency cues. "In this paper, a time/frequency, multi-look masking model is proposed to predict the detection and discrimination of speech-like stimuli in a variety of noise environments. In the first stage of the model, sound is processed through an auditory front end which includes bandpass filtering, squaring, time windowing, logarithmic compression and additive internal noise. The result is an internal representation of time/frequency “looks” for each sound stimulus. To detect or discriminate a signal in noise, the listener combines information across looks using a weighted d′ detection device. Parameters of the model are fit to previously measured masked thresholds of bandpass noises which vary in bandwidth, duration, and center frequency (JASA 101 (1997) 2789). The resulting model is successful in predicting masked thresholds of spectrally shaped noise bursts, glides, and formant transitions of varying durations. The model is also successful in predicting the discrimination of synthetic plosive CV syllables in a variety of noise environments and vowel contexts.”


"Traditional masking models (e.g. Fletcher, 1940; Patterson, 1976) focus on the masking of long duration, narrowband stimuli by noise. In these models, the signal and masker are filtered through an auditory filter that is centered around the signals center frequency. If the filtered signal-to-noise ratio (SNR) is greater than a certain threshold, then the signal is heard. To predict the noise masking of a wide-band, non-stationary signal such as speech, however, the effects of both signal duration and bandwidth must be characterized (over a large frequency and duration range). In addition, for a model to predict perceptual confusions of speech sounds in noise, it should be able to predict the results of discrimination as well as detection experiments. James J. Hant *, Abeer Alwan. 

"In this paper, a time/frequency, multi-look masking model is proposed to predict the detection and discrimination of speech-like stimuli in a variety of noise environments. In the first stage of the model, sound is processed through an auditory front end which includes bandpass filtering, squaring, time windowing, logarithmic compression and additive internal noise. The result is an internal representation of time/frequency “looks” for each sound stimulus. To detect or discriminate a signal in noise, the listener combines information across looks using a weighted d′ detection device. Parameters of the model are fit to previously measured masked thresholds of bandpass noises which vary in bandwidth, duration, and center frequency (JASA 101 (1997) 2789). The resulting model is successful in predicting masked thresholds of spectrally shaped noise bursts, glides, and formant transitions of varying durations. The model is also successful in predicting the discrimination of synthetic plosive CV syllables in a variety of noise environments and vowel contexts.”


"Traditional masking models (e.g. Fletcher, 1940; Patterson, 1976) focus on the masking of long duration, narrowband stimuli by noise. In these models, the signal and masker are filtered through an auditory filter that is centered around the signals center frequency. If the filtered signal-to-noise ratio (SNR) is greater than a certain threshold, then the signal is heard. To predict the noise masking of a wide-band, non-stationary signal such as speech, however, the effects of both signal duration and bandwidth must be characterized (over a large frequency and duration range). In addition, for a model to predict perceptual confusions of speech sounds in noise, it should be able to predict the results of discrimination as well as detection experiments. To our knowledge, there is no published work which presents a masking model”

title: University of California Sexual Harassment and Sexual Violence

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: University of California Sexual Harassment and Sexual Violence
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

-A summary and categorial breakdown of all complaints of Sexual Violence or Sexual Harassment, as covered by the Sexual Violence and Sexual Harassment Policy, received by UC San Diego's office designated for handling such complaints for the years 2018 through 2023. These records may be kept by Academic Year or Fiscal Year. 
-A summary of the outcomes of these complaints, i.e., a count of how many went to Formal Investigation, Alternative Resolution, Informal Resolution, etc.
-If the above information is contained in the Annual Reports that are supposed to be published by the Office for the Prevention of Harassment & Discrimination or the Title IX office, it will be sufficient to send me those in place of the above records.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Maryanne Willkinsin

title: UNR Drone Approvals, Denials, and Registrations

communications.subject: Nevada Public Records Act Request: UNR Drone Approvals, Denials, and Registrations
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Nevada Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

For the period of January 1, 2022 through January 1, 2024 documentation relating to the use of UAS (unmanned aerial vehicles, also known as drones): 

• approvals, denials, and justifying materials from the Vice President of Research and Innovation (VPRI) regarding UAS use for University faculty, staff, and students. 
• Operations plans for UAS use
• UAS operations applications 
• all UAS registration documents

According to "5,030: Policy on Use of Uncrewed Aircraft Systems (UASs) and Drones" https://www.unr.edu/administrative-manual/5000-5999-general-university-services/5030-policy-on-use-of-unmanned-aerial-vehicles-(uavs)-and-drones approvals and denials are the responsibility of the VPRI.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

Your request is being processed in accordance with the Nevada Public Records Act (NPRA), Nevada Revised Statutes (NRS) Chapter 239, and the Nevada System of Higher Education (NSHE) Board of Regents Handbook and Policies. Pursuant to NRS 239.0107(1)(c) within five (5) business days from the day after receiving this request for public record, the UNLV Office of Public Affairs will provide records or notify the requester of of the following: one 
 
  * Provide readily available record(s) to the requester for inspection or copying 
  * Give notice that the University is not the custodian of the record(s) and, if known, refer the requester to the appropriate state agency to request the record(s) 
  * Give notice that the record(s) will not be available within the five-day period and provide an estimated date when the record will be available for release. 
  * Provide notice that the request for release is denied, in part or in whole, and state the legal basis for its decision. If we release records, you can download them for a limited period of 60 days. 
 PLEASE NOTE: Nevada Administrative Code (NAC 239.867) provides no requirement for state agencies to create a public record that does not exist. To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

> A list of names of ICF contractors who provided consulting services in association with the US National Climate Assessment between January 1, 2011, and the date the search is conducted.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Madeleine Stone

title: Procedures, Complaint Form, Staff Roster

communications.subject: Georgia Open Records Act Request: Procedures, Complaint Form, Staff Roster
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide an electronic copy the following;
1.  Your agency's Policy & Procedures
2. Complaint Form
3. Records sufficient to show a current staff roster of all sworn employees with your agency.
        Please include;
        - first and last name of each employee with their corresponding;
        - badge number
        - employee identification number
        - hire date
        - rank or position
        - assigned duty station/substation/precinct/location
        - current salary
This request applies to ALL sworn Department employees, including those at substations.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Marcus Boyd

title: SS General Hans Kammler, 1944-1981 (Central Intelligence Agency)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: SS General Hans Kammler, 1944-1981 (Central Intelligence Agency)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting that the classified documents other and all documents pertaining to the following subjects be declassified and / or released forthwith. I know the Agency is in possession of a large number of these documents and it is long over due for them to be presented to the public and the families of those affected.

ALL documentation about SS-Obergruppenführer (from here on referred to as SS General) Hans Kammler Dr. Engineer (alternate mis-spellings of his name have been found in official files prior, so please expand searches). (for reference) The SS General was in charge of numerous WW2 German special projects, THE JÄGERSTAB, the rocket forces and underground production and research facilities. ALL captured by US forces in 1945 April and May 1945. and investigated by both army and Air-force engineers. As well as all intelligence agencies including ALSOS teams and OSS. 

These reports are still classified, thus I can not provide a specific document reference and insist on a thorough file search given the historical importance of this request.

And ALL OSS files, about and with General Kammler, AND communication with Allan Dulles re. General Kammler. 

I am requesting ALL interrogation reports conducted with the General, conducted after the end of the war in European theater,  AND in CONUS. AND records as to the Generals activities in the US before his death. AND the location of his grave. 

Also I request ALL reports about the Generals activities, during and after WW2. Including the name(s) he was given after the end of the war. 

Note: much of the requested documentation has not yet been declassified, but given the time frame and sensitivity of this information has long passed I request this be found and released.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tino Von Struckmann

Also I request ALL reports about the Generals activities, during and after WW2. Including the name(s) he was given after the end of the war. 

Note: much of the requested documentation has not yet been declassified, but given the time frame and sensitivity of this information has long passed I request this be found and released.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tino Von Struckmann

title: DPD Intelligence on Purported Gangs Hustle Boys and Knock Out Boys

communications.subject: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: DPD Intelligence on Purported Gangs Hustle Boys and Knock Out Boys
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Michigan Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting information from fourteen years ago regarding DPD records relating to two purported gangs--the "Hustle Boys" and the "Knock Out Boys" that the Detroit Police Department was in possession of in 2010. This request includes all "List DPD Narrative" reports containing these two search terms, as well as the underlying reports from those events contained in that search. For instance, we know the search term "Hustle Boys" appears in a 6/18/2009 homicide narrative bearing CRISNET number 0906180015.6 (Supplement 6). We would like the full list of searches, as well as the underlying reports. We are also requesting any Detroit Police Intelligence Data information, to include photos and lists of suspected members of the "Hustle Boys" and "Knock Out Boys" and any information justifying inclusion of those individual in the organizational chart. For instance, we are aware of a chart containing the names Delmerey Morris and Deonta Morris photos that appears to be a roster of people the Detroit Police believed to be in "Hustle Boys." We are asking for any other versions of that chart and all charts relating to the "Knock Out Boys" 

We are requesting any information regarding the gang affiliations of Tyree Washington, JB Watson, Elmer Allwood, and William Beal, if not included in the materials requested above. 

We request any intelligence reports or information regarding the date of formation, the gangs' goals, any list of crimes perpetrated by members of, or in furtherance of, the gangs' enterprise, or other information pertaining to these two purported gangs.

If any information is not available or has been purged, we request the date of the information purge and other information regarding the identity or the entity purging these documents, or the order to purge this information.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Blase Schmid

communications.subject: Fw: [EXTERNAL] Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: DPD Intelligence on Purported Gangs Hustle Boys and Knock Out Boys
communications.communication:
This email serves as the City of Detroit’s response to the above-referenced matter. Your request was received at the City of Detroit Law Department Freedom of Information Act Section via facsimile or email, on March 3, 2024. Because your request was received by electronic transmission, pursuant to Section 5(1) of the Michigan Freedom of Information Act (the “Act”), MCL 15.235(1); it is deemed to have been received at the Law Department on the next business day, March 4, 2024.



Pursuant to Section 5(2) of the Act, MCL 15.235(2), the City’s response is due within five (5) business days. However, due to the nature and the scope of your request and the volume of the requests received by the City, we are extending the City’s response deadline by ten (10) additional business days in accordance with Section 5(2) (d) of the Act, MCL 15.235(2) (d). Therefore, your request will be granted, denied, or granted in part and denied in part on or before March 25, 2024.



Your request is being handled by Amanda Kelly. If you have questions regarding your request, or if you did not provide an email address in your request, please forward it to Amanda Kelly at kellya@detroitmi.gov<mailto:kellya@detroitmi.gov> to provide you a response more readily than by regular mail or fax. Mail and fax are not preferred at this time since they both require in-office support. We thank you in advance for your understanding.

title: Murder Investigation Case File Athony, Delores, Marc and Shelby Harris, Killed in 1989

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Murder Investigation Case File Athony, Delores, Marc and Shelby Harris, Killed in 1989
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to submit a Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to obtain documents related to the murder investigation of Tony and Delores Harris, 15-year-old Shelby, and 11-year-old Marc, which occurred on December 22, 1989, in Danby, NY. The murder investigation was conducted jointly by the New York State Police and the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI).

I kindly request the disclosure of the following information and records, including but not limited to:

Autopsy reports for Tony and Delores Harris, Shelby, and Marc.
Investigation records, including case files, incident reports, and evidence logs.
Audio recordings related to the investigation, such as 911 calls, police radio transmissions, and interviews.
Emails exchanged between investigators, law enforcement agencies, and relevant parties during the course of the investigation.
Phone logs and transcripts pertaining to communication between individuals involved in the case.
Interview records, including transcripts, summaries, and notes from interviews conducted with witnesses, suspects, and persons of interest.
DNA reports and analysis results related to the crime scene and evidence collected.
Letters, correspondences, and written communications associated with the investigation.
Photographs, both digital and hard copies, depicting the crime scene, victims, suspects, and evidence.
Notes, memoranda, and internal communications related to the investigation, including inter-agency communications.
Furthermore, I request that the scope of this FOIA request includes any information and records specifically related to the main suspect, Michael Anthony Kinge, also known as Anthony Turner, born on September 10, 1956, and deceased on February 7, 1990

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jolynn Rice

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jolynn Rice
